abstract.p: South Korea's April trade surplus of $225 million was sharply lower than $2.4 billion a year ago, and cumulative trade surplus in first four months of year to $773 million, from $7 billion a year earlier; exports increased 18.6 percent, to $13.64 billion, while exports surged 47.4 percent, to $13.42 billion (S)

block.p: Dominated by shipments of crude oil and parts for mobile phones, computers and production equipment, imports into South Korea continued to surge in April, further eroding the nation's trade surplus. The April trade surplus of $225 million was sharply lower than the $2.4 billion recorded a year ago, and the cumulative trade surplus in the first four months of the year to $773 million, from $7 billion a year earlier. Exports increased 18.6 percent, to $13.64 billion, last month, while imports surged 47.4 percent, to $13.42 billion, the Ministry of Commerce, Industry and Energy said.
